```{r}

```

```{r}
#correlation among optimism items 
matrix <- corr.test(select(female_helper_psych, optimism_A:optimism_J))$r

cor.plot(matrix)
```

```{r}
#reverse items and run correlations again
female_helper_psych <- female_helper_psych %>%
  mutate(
         optimism_B_r = 7 - optimism_B,
         optimism_C_r = 7 - optimism_C,
         optimism_D_r = 7 - optimism_D)

r_matrix2 <- corr.test(select(female_helper_psych, optimism_A,optimism_B_r,optimism_C_r,optimism_D_r,optimism_E,optimism_F,optimism_G,optimism_H,optimism_I,optimism_J))$r

cor.plot(r_matrix2)
```

```{r}
#exploratory factor analysis 
cor_matrix <- corr.test(select(female_helper_psych, optimism_A,optimism_B_r,optimism_C_r,optimism_D_r,optimism_E,optimism_F,optimism_G,optimism_H,optimism_I,optimism_J))$r
fa <- fa(cor_matrix, nfactors = 3, rotate = "oblimin", fm = "pa")
round(fa$weights, 2)
fa
```

PA1: helplessness: A, G, H, I, J

PA2: hopelessness: B, C, D 

PA3: expectation: E, F 

Raw.alpha for all factors are > 0.70 


```{r}
cfa_model <- 'helplessness =~ optimism_A + optimism_G + optimism_H + optimism_I + optimism_J
              hopelessness =~ optimism_B + optimism_C + optimism_D
              expectation =~ optimism_E + optimism_F'

cfa_fit <- cfa(cfa_model, data = female_helper_psych) 
summary(cfa_fit, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)
```

```{r}
#cor.matrix for relationship satisfaction
sp_matrix <- corr.test(select(female_helper_psych, sp_eqA:sp_relationA))$r

cor.plot(sp_matrix)
```

```{r}
#reverse items and run correlations again
female_helper_psych <- female_helper_psych %>%
  mutate(
         sp_eqD_r = 5 - sp_eqD,
         sp_eqE_r = 5 - sp_eqE,
         sp_eqF_r = 5 - sp_eqF,
         sp_eqG_r = 5 - sp_eqG)

sp_matrix2 <- corr.test(select(female_helper_psych, sp_eqA,sp_eqB,sp_eqC,sp_eqD_r,sp_eqE_r,sp_eqF_r,sp_eqG_r,sp_relation,sp_relationA,sp_relationB))$r

cor.plot(sp_matrix2)
```

```{r}
fa_3 <- fa(sp_matrix2, nfactors = 3, rotate = "oblimin", fm = "pa")

fa_3
```

Factor 1: understanding: eqA, eqB, eqC, eqF
Factor 2: acceptance: eqD, eqE, eqG 
Factor 3: closeness: sp_relation, relation_A, relation_B

```{r}
#cfa model for satisfaction 
cfa_model_2 <- 'understanding =~ sp_eqA + sp_eqB + sp_eqC + sp_eqF_r
              acceptance =~ sp_eqD_r + sp_eqE_r + sp_eqG_r
              closeness =~ sp_relationA + sp_relationB'

cfa_fit_2 <- cfa(cfa_model_2, data = female_helper_psych) 
summary(cfa_fit_2, standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)

```

# Model 1
```{r}
model_f <- '#Measurement model
              helplessness =~ optimism_A + optimism_G + optimism_H + optimism_I + optimism_J
              hopelessness =~ optimism_B + optimism_C + optimism_D
              expectation =~ optimism_E + optimism_F

              understanding =~ sp_eqA + sp_eqB + sp_eqC + sp_eqF_r
              acceptance =~ sp_eqD_r + sp_eqE_r + sp_eqG_r
              closeness =~ sp_relationA + sp_relationB


            #Structural model
            S_CESD ~ S_ADL +R_ADL + R_exp.z + R_income_i.z + S_self_health + R_self_health + helplessness+ hopelessness +  expectation +understanding +acceptance +closeness
            R_CESD ~ R_ADL+ S_ADL + S_self_health + R_self_health + S_income_i.z + S_self_health + R_self_health  + helplessness+ hopelessness +  expectation +understanding +acceptance +closeness

            helplessness ~ R_ADL + S_ADL
            hopelessness~ R_ADL + S_ADL
            expectation~ R_ADL + S_ADL
            understanding~ R_ADL + S_ADL
            acceptance~ R_ADL + S_ADL
            closeness~ R_ADL + S_ADL

            S_self_health ~ R_ADL + S_ADL 
            R_self_health ~ R_ADL + S_ADL 
          
          
            S_ADL ~~  R_ADL 
            S_CESD ~~ R_CESD
            S_self_health ~~ S_self_health_change
            R_self_health ~~ R_self_health_change
      '

fit_f <- sem(model_f, data =female_helper_psych_clean, estimator="MLMV")


varTable(fit_f)
summary(fit_f,standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)

semPaths(fit_f)
```

# Model 2
```{r}
model_f <- '#Measurement model
              helplessness =~ optimism_A + optimism_G + optimism_H + optimism_I + optimism_J
              hopelessness =~ optimism_B + optimism_C + optimism_D
              expectation =~ optimism_E + optimism_F

              understanding =~ sp_eqA + sp_eqB + sp_eqC + sp_eqF_r
              acceptance =~ sp_eqD_r + sp_eqE_r + sp_eqG_r
              closeness =~ sp_relationA + sp_relationB
      
            optimism =~ helplessness  + hopelessness + expectation
            spouse_eq = ~ understanding + acceptance + closeness

            #Structural model
            
            S_CESD ~ S_ADL +R_ADL  + S_self_health + R_self_health + optimism + spouse_eq
            R_CESD ~ R_ADL+ S_ADL + S_self_health + R_self_health  + S_self_health + R_self_health  + optimism + spouse_eq

            optimism ~ R_ADL + S_ADL
            spouse_eq~ R_ADL + S_ADL

            S_self_health ~ R_ADL + S_ADL 
            R_self_health ~ R_ADL + S_ADL 
            
            R_ADL~  age
            S_ADL~ age

            S_ADL ~~  R_ADL 
            S_CESD ~~ R_CESD
            S_self_health ~~ S_self_health_change
            R_self_health ~~ R_self_health_change
      '

fit_f <- sem(model_f, data =female_helper_psych_clean, estimator="MLMV")


varTable(fit_f)
summary(fit_f,standardized = TRUE, fit.measures = TRUE)

semPaths(fit_f)
```
